member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.GetServiceGraphRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetServiceGraph operation. Retrieves a document that describes services that process incoming requests, and downstream services that they call as a result. Root services process incoming requests and make calls to downstream services. Root services are applications that use the AWS X-Ray SDK. Downstream services can be other applications, AWS resources, HTTP web APIs, or SQL databases.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.PutTraceSegmentsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutTraceSegments operation. Uploads segment documents to AWS X-Ray. The X-Ray SDK generates segment documents and sends them to the X-Ray daemon, which uploads them in batches. A segment document can be a completed segment, an in-progress segment, or an array of subsegments.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.Service.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of service.
AWS Resource - The type of an AWS resource. For example, AWS::EC2::Instance for a application running on Amazon EC2 or AWS::DynamoDB::Table for an Amazon DynamoDB table that the application used.
AWS Service - The type of an AWS service. For example, AWS::DynamoDB for downstream calls to Amazon DynamoDB that didn't target a specific table.
client - Represents the clients that sent requests to a root service.
remote - A downstream service of indeterminate type.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayRequest
member.summary: Base class for XRay operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing XRay
AWS X-Ray provides APIs for managing debug traces and retrieving service maps and other data created by processing those traces.

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonXRayClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonXRayClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.BatchGetTraces(Amazon.XRay.Model.BatchGetTracesRequest)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of traces specified by ID. Each trace is a collection of segment documents that originates from a single request. Use GetTraceSummaries to get a list of trace IDs.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchGetTraces service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchGetTraces service method, as returned by XRay.
member.exception: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.

member.summary: Initiates the asynchronous execution of the BatchGetTraces operation.

A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.GetServiceGraph(Amazon.XRay.Model.GetServiceGraphRequest)
member.summary: Retrieves a document that describes services that process incoming requests, and downstream services that they call as a result. Root services process incoming requests and make calls to downstream services. Root services are applications that use the AWS X-Ray SDK. Downstream services can be other applications, AWS resources, HTTP web APIs, or SQL databases.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetServiceGraph service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetServiceGraph service method, as returned by XRay.
member.exception: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.IAmazonXRay
member.summary:
Interface for accessing XRay
AWS X-Ray provides APIs for managing debug traces and retrieving service maps and other data created by processing those traces.
